content.text: Connect the circuit shown in Fig. 1.1
E, F, G and H are crocodile clips
Using the long connecting lead, clip crocodile clips F and G on the resistance wire so that they are approximately \(0.45 \text{m}\) apart
The length of resistance wire between F and G is x
The current in the circuit is \(I\)
Repeat until you have six sets of values of \(x\) and \(I\)
Record your results in a table. Include values of \(\frac{1}{I}\) in your table
Plot a graph of \(\frac{1}{I}\) on the \(y\)-axis against \(x\) on the \(x\)-axis
Draw the straight line of best fit
Determine the gradient and \(y\)-intercept of this line
It is suggested that the quantities \(I\) and \(x\) are related by
Using your answers in (c)(iii), determine the values of \(a\) and \(b\)

parts.label: (e)

content.text: where \(P\) is the resistance per unit length of the resistance wire and \(Q\) is \(1.5 \text{V}\)
Use your value of \(a\) to calculate the value of \(P\)

content.text: You are provided with two lengths of plastic pipe
Select one of them and, using the waterproof pen, label one end A
Make a mark approximately \(12\mathrm{cm}\) from end A, as shown in Fig. 2.1
The distance from end A to the mark is \(L\), as shown in Fig. 2.1
Use the thermometer to measure the room temperature \(T_0\)

content.text: Set up the apparatus as shown in Fig. 2.2
The point Z is the lower edge of the end of the wooden strip
Ensure that end A is at the bottom of the measuring cylinder
The distance between the centre of the bolt and the centre of the nail is \(s\)
The distance between the centre of the nail and the end of the wooden strip is \(d\), as shown in Fig. 2.2
